virtualAssistantBioStatic: The Virtual Assistant is a chatbot. When you apply for a new benefit, the Virtual Assistant will guide you to make your experience as easy as possible.
virtualAssistantInfoTitleStatic: What can the Virtual Assistant do?
virtualAssistantInfo1: Help you overcome obstacles you may face when applying for a benefit (for example, if you‚Äôre missing a document)
virtualAssistantInfo2: Change your account details (for example, it can update your home address)
virtualAssistantInfo3: Answer specific questions about your file (for example, check the status of your application)
virtualAssistantLogoAlt: Virtual assistant asking Can I help you?
scenario1MaryAlt: Mary looking at her mobile phone
scenario2HafsaIntro: Hafsa applies for Old Age Security.
scenario2HafsaAlt: Hafsa sitting at a desk looking at her laptop
scenario3RayIntro: Ray applies for Lorem Ipsum Lorem.
scenario3RayAlt: Ray sitting on a sofa looking at his tablet
scenarioPart1: Mary loses her job. She applies for Employment Insurance. Two or three weeks go by, and she‚Äôs starting to wonder about the status of her application, and why she has not been paid.
scenarioPart1-1: Looking for answers, she logs into the Service Canada Digital Centre finds a new message in her inbox.
scenarioPart2: Mary doesn‚Äôt normally use chatbots. However, since the chatbot says it might be able to help, she gives it a try. After a few exchanges, she learns that her previous employer never submitted her Record of Employment.
scenarioPart3: Luckily, the Virtual Assistant has a solution. With Mary‚Äôs approval, the Virtual Assistant sends an email to Mary‚Äôs previous employer, requesting that they submit a Record of Employment as soon as possible. Mary is relieved. The Virtual Assistant saved her from having an awkward conversation with her previous employer, and took action to get her payments started as soon as possible.
scenarioPart4: The Virtual Assistant offers to inform Mary when the Record of Employment comes in. Mary is pleasantly surprised when the Virtual Assistant offers to notify her by email, text message or both. She chooses both. Finally, the Virtual Assistant asks Mary to rate the service she received out of 5. Mary gives it a 4, and logs out of the Service Canada Digital Centre.
scenarioPart4-1: This experience informs Mary of the block on the file and guides her towards a solution to getting her benefits faster.
figureCaption1: A chat conversation between Mary and the Virtual Assistant. The Assistant says: ‚ÄúHi Mary, I‚Äôm your Virtual Assistant! I looked at your application and I can see there‚Äôs a block on your file. Do you want me to look into that?

Mary: ‚Äú a@b.com ‚Äù 

Assistant: ‚ÄúOk, sent! Do you want me to notify you when we‚Äôve received your Record of Employment?‚Äù
scenarioBody: Imagine you are someone named Mary. You recently lost your job and apply for Employment Insurance. Two or three weeks later, you have not heard anything about your application, or received any money.‚ÄØ Looking for answers, you log into the Service Canada Digital Centre, and find a new message in your Inbox‚Ä¶
virtualAssistantBioBody: The Virtual Assistant is a chatbot. When you apply for a new benefit, the Virtual Assistant will guide you to make your experience as easy as possible.
metaDescription: The Service Canada Virtual Assistant demo presents a conversational chatbot that can help overcome obstacles when applying for a benefit.
